data.text: Watch again: Lagarde at the #ECBListens event on taking climate change into account in the #ECBstrategyreview https://t.co/Q7yy04PlLP
Watch again: Lane at the #ECBListens event on reviewing the inflation buffer https://t.co/NZxh0vajAL
Watch again: Lagarde at the #ECBListens event on hearing from civil society and non-governmental organisations as part of the #ECBstrategyreview https://t.co/ETtREdEJcN

Watch: President Lagarde’s message to staff on the occasion of #GlobalEthicsDay

https://t.co/8Vpl3w5kOQ

@mvanhulten @Lagarde Hello @mvanhulten, thanks again for joining the discussion earlier today. In case you haven't seen it yet, here's the press release on the internal whistleblowing framework https://t.co/uf1QKaSRr1

We care about transparency, so we now publish the Ethics Committee’s opinions on potential conflicts of interest involving the ECB’s high-level officials as well as on their professional activities after they leave the ECB. Read more https://t.co/N4PxJU5R9K

We care about integrity and about those who stand up for it. That’s why we are enhancing our whistleblowing framework to give our staff the confidence to speak up if they witness any wrongdoing. Press release https://t.co/uf1QKaSRr1

Today is #GlobalEthicsDay. Our credibility depends on the trust the people of Europe place in us. This is why we are committed to performing our duties impartially and with integrity. And we work constantly to strengthen our efforts. Find out more https://t.co/N4PxJU5R9K https://t.co/mAIxn9ippF
@actforculture @tbadtod Thank you for contributing to the discussion today and for your input.
Speech Luis de Guindos: Loukas Karabarbounis’s contribution to research on the interaction between labour and capital market imperfections and macroeconomic outcomes https://t.co/MdoONCUaUl
Presentation Philip R. Lane: International flows and the pandemic - Evidence from the euro area https://t.co/joMuFjDfso
@PositiveMoneyEU @Lagarde Thanks for joining the discussion and sharing your ideas.
@ShareAction @wokuhn @Lagarde Thank you for joining in the conversation today and your ideas.
@Adam_Pawloff @lordstern1 Thank you participating in the discussion and for sharing your input with us.
@SchmalzriedMar1 Thanks for joining the discussion and for your input.
@sorcha_edwards Thank for joining the conversation and for sharing your ideas.

You can also share your views via the #ECBListens Portal https://t.co/fgZEUUtrZP

#ECBstrategyreview
Working paper: Money markets, central bank balance sheet and regulation https://t.co/HlwNVsJczs
Watch the first #ECBListens event hosted by ECB President Christine @Lagarde and Philip R. Lane #ECBstrategyreview https://t.co/flYREeNNOW

Coming up in 15 minutes: the first #ECBListens event, with civil society organisations, hosted by ECB President Christine @Lagarde and Chief Economist Philip R. Lane. Watch live here on Twitter and on our website. https://t.co/HNGaud8qER
ECB President Christine @Lagarde discussed the second wave of the pandemic currently underway in Europe in an interview with @DariusRochebin of @LCI. https://t.co/J1Jdj6QsKv
La Présidente de la BCE Christine @Lagarde a évoqué la deuxième vague de la pandémie qui touche actuellement l’Europe dans un entretien avec @DariusRochebin de @LCI. https://t.co/gKDJs5Ps2p

Chefökonom Philip R. Lane diskutiert mit @ntvde über die EZB Strategieüberprüfung, den Brexit und die Risiken für die europäische Wirtschaft. Hier das Interview (ab 5:25 min) https://t.co/LuvEChhqqX https://t.co/8bbYLMPdR1

Schnabel: The wealth of new granular data sources requires continuous improvements and innovations in sharing data and communicating them interactively. The ECB has taken a first step in the right direction by making data easily accessible at https://t.co/NB6DdftVIx 3/3

Schnabel: Data and statistics need to be independent and reliable, and have to be communicated effectively. In the Eurosystem, the production of data and statistics is a multi-layered process with extensive checks to ensure the highest data quality 2/3 https://t.co/XRMwIO9fex

(THREAD) Reliable data and statistics are crucial for sound policy decisions, including @ecb, writes Executive Board member @Isabel_Schnabel in #TheECBBlog. Today’s #WorldStatisticsDay reminds us that high-quality data should not be taken for granted https://t.co/m7cDRvmzAY 1/3 https://t.co/7bTkaAcIRc
Euro area monthly balance of payments (Aug 2020) https://t.co/2yDa12MBMr

Our banking supervision portal is live! It offers a single point of access for external users to our online supervisory services. You can use it to initiate a fit and proper assessment, or to exchange documents with supervisors. Check out at https://t.co/nztAGIdGf4 https://t.co/mKeiRwyAjG
Speech Yves Mersch: The ECB’s monetary policy amid the pandemic https://t.co/aiKBdIrjGY
Opening remarks Christine Lagarde - ECB Conference on Monetary Policy https://t.co/G305JuDGDg

How usable are regulatory capital buffers, and what factors may prevent banks from using them in the crisis? What is the importance of countercyclical buffers for releasing capital? Read this and more in the Macroprudential Bulletin https://t.co/4a1qyHJJX9 https://t.co/m2fAegHbA0

Lagarde: La crise a poussé l’Europe à réviser son approche à l’équilibre budgétaire, la dette et l’intervention de l’Etat, et à comprendre que nous sommes dans le même bateau: si les économies fragiles s’affaiblissent, les plus solides souffrent aussi https://t.co/xag7NJ91f5 3/3

Lagarde: Nous estimons que notre action entre mars et juin a généré l’équivalent de 1,3 point de croissance et de 0,8 point d’inflation, et que nous avons sauvé un million d’emplois. Et nous n’avons pas encore épuisé tous nos outils: s’il faut faire plus, nous ferons plus 2/3

(THREAD) Nous serons très attentifs aux indicateurs économiques tout au long de l’automne, dit Présidente @Lagarde au @lemondefr. Notre scénario central prévoit pour 2020 une chute moyenne du PIB de 8%. Si la situation se détériore, cela noircira évidemment nos prévisions 1/3 https://t.co/1MbIZJbm1Q

Lagarde: The crisis has made Europe reconsider its approach on budget balancing, debt and state intervention. It has made us realise that we are in the same boat: a weakening of already fragile economies would make stronger ones suffer too https://t.co/iAJPY79XpG 3/3

Lagarde: We estimate that our action between March and June has boosted growth and inflation by 1.3 and 0.8 percentage points respectively, and that we have saved one million jobs. And we have not exhausted our toolbox yet. If more has to be done, we will do more 2/3

(THREAD) We will keep a close watch on economic indicators throughout the autumn, President @Lagarde tells @lemondefr. Our central scenario foresees an 8% average fall in euro area GDP in 2020. If the situation deteriorates, our projections will obviously be gloomier 1/3 https://t.co/NenMdufJVf
Remarks Christine Lagarde at the G30 International Banking Seminar https://t.co/hlVqCkvbFK
Interview Fabio Panetta with Kathimerini https://t.co/htecR0RT4X (EN) https://t.co/pejWuYDNbT (EL) https://t.co/K7YVDz9nhV (IT)
Panetta: We need to quickly return to growth: the longer it takes to return to pre-crisis levels, the greater the impact on inequality and disparity 3/3

Panetta: In view of the sheer size of the downside risks, there should not be any doubt about our determination to preserve price stability. We will not allow any tightening of financing conditions that gets in the way of our aim 2/3

(THREAD) The resurgence of infections is weakening the recovery. This reinforces the need for prolonged support from macroeconomic policies, says Executive Board member Fabio Panetta in an interview with Kathimerini https://t.co/pLd0B0LQCw 1/3 https://t.co/FwCn6F3oxY

Alumnus dell’anno dell’ @Unibocconi, Andrea Enria afferma che la vigilanza bancaria comune ha permesso una risposta più rapida e unificata alla crisi. Ma bisogna completare velocemente l’Unione bancaria per salvaguardare il successo del progetto europeo https://t.co/XzHk91hM6J https://t.co/qwSpCs2Sxd
You’ll also be able to watch it live here on Twitter. Share your views and ideas via the #ECBListens Portal, available in all euro area languages https://t.co/M5ovZKCDgS

Tune in on 21 October to the first #ECBListens event, hosted by ECB President Christine Lagarde and Chief Economist Philip R. Lane. They will be engaging with civil society organisations as part of the #ECBstrategyreview. 

Watch live on our website https://t.co/ZGqONLMSKN https://t.co/4wkFAqqZrr
IMFC Statement Christine Lagarde https://t.co/WH64XQYTLG
Working paper: Central bank information effects and transatlantic spillovers https://t.co/2J3yDHW3ek
Working paper: Firm-specific shocks and contagion - Are banks special? https://t.co/Iw3aqBMgAj
Speech Philip R. Lane: The pandemic and ECB monetary policy (slides) https://t.co/ylj548zm5R
Occasional paper: A review of economic analyses on the potential impact of Brexit https://t.co/9r0EVNBgQJ

In the latest #TheECBPodcast episode, our guest @RobertMAnderton explains how the digital market strategy set up by the @EU_Commission can improve competitiveness in the EU. Curious for more? Tune in with @MichaelSteen https://t.co/piQlaFTwih https://t.co/0Hn1HyyGJx

@sam_clements Banknotes that have been damaged intentionally are not exchanged. You can approach any of the euro area central banks – their contact details are listed on our website https://t.co/7ppiEIEb31 2/2

Panetta: The value of money is rooted in citizens’ trust, and acceptance by the public is crucial. We are seeking feedback on the design and social issues surrounding the potential introduction of a digital euro https://t.co/RiwOCers68 https://t.co/Ukdd5Hye6H

Panetta: A digital euro would conform to the people’s fundamental right to privacy – we are already exploring ways of enhancing it. Unlike private suppliers, the central bank has no commercial interests related to consumer data. Full speech https://t.co/8R9W5J1i5G 3/3

Panetta: We do not have a digital currency issued by the central bank that we can use for all our daily transactions. A digital euro would fill this gap and be a digital equivalent of euro banknotes. It would complement cash, not replace it 2/3

(THREAD) Central banks have the fundamental task of providing citizens with costless access to simple, secure and risk-free means of payment, says Executive Board member Fabio Panetta presenting the Eurosystem's report on a digital euro 1/3 https://t.co/8R9W5J1i5G https://t.co/lC3Ojpc5pB

Coming up at 18:45 CET: Executive Board member Fabio Panetta will present the Eurosystem's report on a digital euro at the European Parliament’s Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs @EP_Economics.

Follow live https://t.co/cwghJ3YjSi

Enria: The ban on dividends was an exceptional measure to allow banks to keep lending, not intended to become a regular supervisory tool. Before lifting the ban, we need to see where the economy is heading and how robust banks’ capital plans are again https://t.co/C2r2y5IEqh 5/5

Enria: The response to the last crisis did not fix the structural problems of the banking market. Consolidation can be part of the solution this time to reduce overcapacity. Obstacles to moving around capital and liquidity should be removed to facilitate cross-border mergers 4/5

Enria: If the economy evolves in line with our baseline scenario, banks should be able to handle the increase in bad loans. But we cannot yet rule out the severe scenario, with up to €1.4 trillion in bad loans. An asset management company could be a useful clean-up tool 3/5

Enria: Now banks must take a hard look at their loan books and work out which clients are really going to survive the crisis, so that the wave of bad loans doesn’t have a chance to get too big. All banks must also build up their capacity to process bad loans 2/5

(THREAD) The ECB’s top priority in the spring was to prevent banks from tightening their lending standards too much and to avoid a credit crunch, Supervisory Board Chair Andrea Enria says in an interview with Handelsblatt 1/5 https://t.co/nw0Pc2wg7u

When interest rates are low, there are strong complementarities between fiscal and monetary policy, says Executive Board member @Isabel_Schnabel. Using fiscal and structural policies more actively today will support price stability. Read the full speech https://t.co/IKWKVg8b1s https://t.co/acUBXqTnnS
Euro area securities issues statistics (Aug 2020) https://t.co/xELGWta9Qa

Lane: Under current conditions it's important that fiscal policy is active and responds to the needs of the economy. It’s important to have a lot of fiscal support this year and next. When the times are good, we want to see debt ratios come down (7/7) https://t.co/MQDDV78ppH
Lane: Asset purchases have a bigger impact on the yield curve now than interest rate cuts. But the option of cutting interest rates remains part of our policy guidance (6/7)

Lane: Current inflation level remains far away from our goal, we don’t think that is a satisfactory inflation outlook. We will not tighten policy without inflation solidly appearing in the data. (5/7)

Lane: Evidence shows that we’ve been very symmetric, that we’ve done a lot since 2014 to respond to low inflation. In terms of our monetary policy strategy review, it’s important that our medium term orientation is to get inflation back to where we think it should be (4/7)

Lane: Whether we need to add stimulus depends on incoming data. The uncertainty will diminish in the autumn because we’ll know more about the pandemic, 2021 budget plans, exchange rate developments and oil prices (3/7)

Lane: The single biggest risk is that the pandemic is not controlled and/or it takes longer than is currently expected to find good treatments and a vaccine. That outranks any other risk by some distance (2/7)

Probably the most important thing to say about the eurozone economy is that there is a high degree of uncertainty, Executive Board member Philip R. Lane tells The Wall Street Journal (1/7) https://t.co/MQDDV78ppH https://t.co/wBxADgDPwe
Contribution Isabel Schnabel: The ECB’s independence in times of mounting public debt https://t.co/f45wrJM7Cn

Enria and Fernandez-Bollo: Group support agreements would enable cross-border banking groups to manage their liquidity more efficiently while reassuring group entities. They would also be a step towards a truly integrated European banking market https://t.co/AiBaui3CKD 3/3

Enria and Fernandez-Bollo: Group recovery plans should play a central role. To strengthen them, one step could be to let subsidiaries and parent companies conclude formal agreements on liquidity support within the group, and to create the necessary incentives and safeguards 2/3

(THREAD) We need to foster the integration of cross-border banking groups to ensure that timely liquidity support is provided within them, write Andrea Enria and Edouard Fernandez-Bollo in The Supervision Blog 1/3 https://t.co/aDxg5AIOsi
Submit your comments on the #ECBstrategyreview via the #ECBListens Portal until the end of October https://t.co/ki2QFfpTcj https://t.co/Q5M2da8Jei

The ECB’s goal has been to ensure that banks can continue lending to the economy, Supervisory Board member Kerstin af Jochnick says on the supervisory response and priorities during the crisis in a fireside chat at l’AGEFI Global Invest Forum https://t.co/Z0TpqVmZrm https://t.co/n8Xrl2qKdH
Account of the monetary policy meeting of the Governing Council of the ECB on 9-10 September 2020 https://t.co/zH5rJ9CUhv
Speech Yves Mersch: European economic governance - Early lessons from the crisis https://t.co/G74OLBCtJC

Watch live from 9:25 CET: Executive Board member @Isabel_Schnabel participates in a panel discussion on the impact of the coronavirus crisis at the #SRBResolution2020 Conference https://t.co/aQgVr7j8t3 https://t.co/3Z0fhM1yPC
Working paper: The impact of G-SIB identification on bank lending - Evidence from syndicated loans https://t.co/nlsdwc7Zda
Working paper: Covid-19 and rural landscape - The case of Italy https://t.co/8vP7AZiXjV
ECB publishes summary of feedback on public consultation on compounded €STR rates https://t.co/I3SA67n2ee
ECB appoints Wolfgang Proissl as Director General Communications https://t.co/V0NaoySa5q

Follow live https://t.co/tlvSRTAwHo https://t.co/JRAHf3F6az

Working paper: Green asset pricing 
https://t.co/SH1ExdKT4b

Coming up shortly: President Christine @Lagarde participates in a panel discussion to mark the anniversaries of the Werner Report and the Euro Rescue Funds.

Supervisory Banking Statistics - Second quarter 2020 https://t.co/WnnwMHOJBR
Euro money market statistics (fifth maintenance period 2020) https://t.co/kUg0FjaFDo
Letter from Andrea Enria, Chair of the Supervisory Board, to Mr Schirdewan, MEP, on banking supervision https://t.co/BrNd1jF5zC
Working paper: The (ir)relevance of the nominal lower bound for real yield curve analysis https://t.co/ad1vT8sMgL
Working paper: Financial drivers of the euro area business cycle - A DSGE-based approach https://t.co/BxBsDanPu9

In the platform economy both sides of the market match through an online platform. It has grown due to the wider use of new technologies and smartphones, says @LaravmVivian on #TheECBPodcast. Find out more about the platform economy with @MichaelSteen https://t.co/piQlaFTwih https://t.co/j7v5Ifyvxe
Statistics on households and non-financial corporations in the euro area (Q2 2020) https://t.co/Tgg87xKGZM
Working paper: Sectoral output effects of monetary policy - Do sticky prices matter? https://t.co/WTkqshNqwz
Working paper: Borrowing constraints, own labour and homeownership - Does it pay to paint your walls? https://t.co/Ch21bXVjUO
Euro area quarterly balance of payments and international investment position (Q2 2020) https://t.co/jkRkcAEsFg

Acceptance of a digital euro by the public is crucial, writes Executive Board member Fabio Panetta in #TheECBBlog. We want to listen and learn about people’s needs, preferences and concerns with regard to a digital euro. Read more https://t.co/ye4xHTRwS9 https://t.co/qRfpDBeJrG

It is too early to identify any specific type of digital euro, but we have laid down some basic requirements, such as robustness, safety, efficiency, privacy and compliance with the law. We will now listen and experiment to define what it might look like in the future 3/3
